label: 内大臣
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: The earliest reference to the office is a report of Nakatomi (Fujiwara) Kamatari's appointment after the 645 coup, but there are doubts as to the historicity of this report. In the Nara period, Fujiwara Fuhito's son, Fusasaki, was made Genshō Tennō's inner palace minister when Gemmei Tennō died tension over succession reached new heights. [中臣（藤原）鎌足、藤原不比等、房前、元正天皇、元明天皇]
